title: obsidian_rock
body:
[b]Obsidian[/b] is a naturally occurring volcanic glass formed as an extrusive igneous rock.

It is produced when felsic lava extruded from a volcano cools rapidly with minimum crystal growth. Obsidian is commonly found within the margins of rhyolitic lava flows known as obsidian flows, where the chemical composition (high silica content) induces a high viscosity and polymerization degree of the lava. 

The inhibition of atomic diffusion through this highly viscous and polymerized lava explains the lack of crystal growth. Obsidian is hard and brittle; it therefore fractures with very sharp edges, which had been used in the past in cutting and piercing tools, and are still used as surgical scalpel blades.

Well-crafted obsidian blades have a cutting edge many times sharper than high-quality steel surgical scalpels, the cutting edge of the blade being only about 3 nanometers thick. Even the sharpest metal knife has a jagged, irregular blade when viewed under a strong enough microscope; when examined even under an electron microscope an obsidian blade is still smooth and even. 

Plinths for audio turntables have been made of obsidian since the 70s.

Obsidian is also used for ornamental purposes and as a [[obsidian (gemstone)|gemstone]]. It possesses the property of presenting a different appearance according to the manner in which it is cut: when cut in one direction it is jet black; in another it is glistening gray.

title: herobrine
body:
Herobrine (a.k.a. "HIM") is a mythical [[Minecraft]] character whose origins can be traced to a piece of "creepy-pasta" believed to have come from [[4chan]]. According to the hoax, Herobrine is supposedly the spirit of Minecraft creator and former lead developer Markus "Notch" Persson's deceased brother, who now haunts the Minecraft world, appearing at random and constructing traps for the player to eventually fall into, among other odd behavior.  It should be noted that Notch has no brother, deceased or otherwise.

Although Herobrine has never officially existed in any version of Minecraft, the character has become a well-known meme within the player community, and mods exist that attempt to replicate the effects described in the original "creepy-pasta" story.  Even Mojang, the company behind Minecraft, has somewhat accepted the character, to the extent that most changelogs for updated versions of the game include the line "Removed Herobrine" as a joke.

Herobrine is usually represented as the default Minecraft player skin, [[Steve (minecraft)|]], with pupilless and/or glowing white eyes.  

h4. External links

* "Minecraft wiki: Herobrine":[http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/Herobrine]

title: metroid
body:
The [b]Metroid[/b] ([b]メトロイド[/b]) games are a series of video games produced by [[Nintendo]]. One of the company's most successful franchises, the [[science fiction]] series spans through several Nintendo systems, with the first game, Metroid, released in 1986 for the Famicon and in 1987 for the [[nes|Nintendo Entertainment System]]. 

The Metroid games chronicle the missions of bounty hunter [[Samus Aran]] in a [[science fiction]] setting which contains many similarities to the [[Alien (1979)|]] film franchise. Central plot elements are the [[Metroid (creature)|]] organisms and the [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]]s which try to exploit the Metroids' powers. The gameplay combines adventure based on exploration and item-gathering with platformer and shooter dynamics. The Metroid games are famous for their nonlinear gameplay, where one can complete a game with a fraction of the items available in the game. 

For the titular alien lifeform, use the [[Metroid (Creature)]] tag.

h4. List of games

* [[Metroid (classic)|Metroid (NES)]]

title: japanese_communist_party
body:
[[Japan]]'s leading [[communism|communist]] party and the first political party of the county, first founded in 1922.

Historically had/has strained relationships with the People's Republic of China and the Soviet Union. Was seen by the [[gakusei undou|Japanese New Left]] as part of the Old Left, alongside the Japan Socialist Party (today's Social Democratic Party, which leaned towards Beijing in that period), and continues to receive leftist criticism to this day.

The party long benefited from protest votes, as a third party choice distinct from the main opposition groups (and opposed to the third party choices on the right). Today, it is one of the largest non-governing communist parties in the world.

The party has "many mascots":https://twitter.com/CiaranDold/status/1254741875354894337 representing various aspects of their platform and the people they represent, main one of which is [[Koyou no Youko]].

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Japanese Communist Party":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_Communist_Party
* "Official website (in English)":https://www.jcp.or.jp/english/

title: kawakaze_(azur_lane)
body:
Ninth ship of the Shiratsuyu-class destroyers, IJN [i]Kawakaze[/i] (江風), as she appears in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i].

Kawakaze in story serves as the bodyguard for [[Nagato (azur lane)|Nagato]]. Her demeanor is typically much colder in comparison to her sisters, likely as a result of such a serious duty.

As she was designed by [[Nagishiro Mito]], she [[creator_connection|bears a striking resemblance]] to [[Shirakami Fubuki]], seemingly [[look-alike]]s (they are both variants to the artist's monochrome-style [[fox girl]] design). While it has been pointed out long ago, it came even further to light when the latter became available in the game via a collaboration event in December 2019, Fubuki even having a line pointing this out.

Voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]].

h4. Appearance

[tn]See post #3144151[/tn]

Kawakaze has [[blue eyes]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]], as well as [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]] that both have accents of black. Her outfit consists of black and white kimono, that also possesses a [[sailor collar]] and [[blue ribbon]] similar to a serafuku. She wears a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], black [[thighhighs]] and heels that appear to be made out of metal plates. She also possesses several straight black [[katana|katanas]].

h4. Related Characters

title: spring_roll
body:
Spring rolls, also known as spring pancakes, spring rolls, and thin pancakes, are a traditional Chinese food popular during various folk festivals in China. 

They are popular throughout various regions in China, particularly in areas like Jiangnan. In southern China, during the Spring Festival, people do not eat jiaozi but instead consume spring rolls and sesame tangyuan.

title: aic
body:
[b]Anime International Company, Inc.[/b] (Japanese: 株式会社アニメインターナショナルカンパニー,  [i]Kabushiki-gaisha Anime Intānashonaru Kanpanī[/i]), often abbreviated as [b]AIC[/b]is a Japanese animation studio  founded on June 15, 1982  and originally located in Nerima, Tokyo, Japan. 

On December 10, 2015, [b]AIC RIGHTS Co., Ltd[/b] was established through a company split, in which AIC Rights received the transfer of some of the copyrights owned by Anime International Company.

Their notable works include series such as [[Tenchi Muyou!]], [[Bubblegum Crisis]], [[Megazone 23]], [[El Hazard]], and several adaptations of the manga [[aa_megami-sama|Oh! My Goddess]].

AIC had eight sub-studios within itself, named: "AIC ASTA" (2003, formerly: "AIC A.S.T.A."), "AIC Build" (2010), "AIC Classic" (2010), "AIC Digital" (1997), "AIC Frontier" (June, 2012), "AIC PLUS+" (2006), "AIC Spirits" (2003) and "AIC Takarazuka" (2006).

title: tagalog_text
body: The official dialect and often the assumed official language (by name) of the Philippines. While it is the lingua franca of the Philippines, it is formally known as the Filipino language. Both terms (Tagalog and Filipino) are used interchangeably. The name comes from the word "Taga-ilog" (river-dwellers) whose spoken language became the basis for modern Filipino. The language has plenty of loanwords and is often code-switched with English. While it is historically written in Baybayin script, Tagalog is written using Latin characters.

title: hamas
body:
[b]Hamas[/b] (Arabic: حركة المقاومة الإسلامية, Ḥarakat al-Muqāwamah al-ʾIslāmiyyah, lit. 'Islamic Resistance Movement'), is a [[palestine|Palestinian]] [[Islam]]ist political and paramilitary movement founded on 10 December 1987. The group played a prominent role on [[israel-hamas war|guerrilla warfare]] against the [[israel defense forces|IDF]]. 

Hamas has been accused of political violence and alleged human rights violations, particularly by Israel's allies. Therefore, many countries that have positive relationships with Israel designated Hamas as a [[terrorist]] organization.

Hamas personnel are generally recognizable by their head-wrapping [[keffiyeh]]s and [[green headband]]s often inscriped with [[arabic text|shahada]] text based on their party flag.

h1. External links
* Wikipedia: "Hamas":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamas

title: falcata
body:
A type of [[sword]] native to ancient pre-Roman Iberia (now Spain and Portugal). A falcata has a single-edged blade that pitches forward towards the point, the edge being concave near the hilt, but convex near the point. A similar weapon called a kopis was used in Ancient Greece and Persia.

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]

title: help:number_syntax
body:
Number syntax has two different forms, depending on whether it's part of a field search or a post search.

h4. Integer / Float / Datetime / Interval fields

When searching with numbers, the following variation in search parameters may be used.

h5. Direct comparisons

These take the text field in its entirety when making the comparison as selected by the qualifier. The following qualifiers are available.

* (No qualifier) - "Basic":[#dtext-basic] comparison.
* [code]*_not[/code] - "Basic":[#dtext-basic] comparison (negated).
* [code]*_eq[/code] - Direct comparison.
* [code]*_not_eq[/code] - Direct inequality comparison.
* [code]*_gt[/code] - Greater-than comparison.
* [code]*_gteq[/code] - Greater-than or equal comparison.
* [code]*_lt[/code] - Less-than comparison.
* [code]*_lteq[/code] - Less-than or equal comparison.

[i]Example:[/i]

[code]search[id_eq]=100[/code]

Searches for records where the ID is 100.

h5#basic. Basic syntax

h6. Multiple values

* 100,200,300 (the values 100, 200 and 300)

h6. Less than or equal to

* <100 (less than only)
* <=100 (less than or equal to)

h6. Greater than or equal to

* >100 (greater than only)
* >=100 (greater than or equal to)

h6. Intervals

* 100..200 (all numbers between 100 and 200, inclusive)
* 100...200 (all numbers between 100 and 200, excludes 200)
* ..100 (equivalent to <=100)
* 100.. (equivalent to >=100)

[i]Note: intervals only work from low to high, i.e. 100..200 will work while 200..100 won't.[/i]

h6. Combination values/intervals

* 98,100..200,202 (all numbers between 100 and 200, inclusive, plus 98 and 202)

h6. Absolutes

* none (null values)
* any (non-null values)

h4. Post search

In post searches, the syntax goes like this:

[code][metatag]:[number][/code]

[i]Example:[/i]

{{id:100}}

Values can be passed in using the "basic":[#dtext-basic] syntax.

[i]Examples:[/i]

{{width:<=100}} {{mpixels:5..}} {{id:100..200}}

h6. Metatags where basic syntax can be used

* [code]id[/code]
* [code]width[/code]
* [code]height[/code]
* [code]score[/code]
* [code]mpixels[/code]
* [code]ratio[/code]
* [code]filesize[/code]
* [code]age[/code]
* [code]date[/code]
* [code]tagcount[/code]
* [code]gentags[/code]
* [code]arttags[/code]
* [code]chartags[/code]
* [code]copytags[/code]
* [code]pixiv[/code]
* [code]pixiv_id[/code]

h6. Metatags where basic syntax cannot be used

* [code]limit[/code]
* [code]parent[/code]
* [code]child[/code]
* [code]pool[/code]

h5. Units

With certain metatags, units are used. The basic syntax works the same with units.

Syntax:
[code][metatag]:[number][unit][/code]

[i]Example:[/i]
{{age:..10weeks}}

h6. Age units

These units are used together with the [i]age[/i] metatag.

* seconds (s)
* minutes (mi)
* hours (h)
* days (d)
* weeks (w)
* months (mo)
* years (y)

The shorthand version is in parenthesis. You can use any number of characters between the shorthand version and full version. For example, "se" or "sec" work in place of s or seconds. 

[i]Example:[/i]
{{age:2weeks..1mo}}

[i]Note: not specifying the time unit is no longer supported and will return no results. "m" will also return no results as it is ambiguous between minutes and months.[/i]

[i]Note: singular and plural forms of units can be used interchangeably.[/i]

h6. Filesize units

These units are used together with the [i]filesize[/i] metatag.

* b (bytes)
* kb (kilobytes)
* m (megabytes)

Only the shorthand versions will work, i.e. bytes, kilobytes and megabytes are not part of the syntax.

[i]Example:[/i]
{{filesize:<=10kb}}

[i]Note: if no unit is specified it defaults to bytes.[/i]

[i]Note: for anyone curious, 1m = 1024kb and 1kb = 1024b.[/i]

h6. Ratios

For the metatag [i]ratio[/i], fractions are commonly used but you may use decimal notation also.

The aspect ratio denotes the relationship between the width and height of an image. For example, a 1:1 ratio means the width and height are equal whereas a 4:3 ratio means the width is one third longer (4/3) than the height. Useful aspect ratio tool: http://andrew.hedges.name/experiments/aspect_ratio/

Syntax:
[code]ratio:[width]/[height]
ratio:[number][/code]

[i]Examples:[/i]
* {{ratio:16/9}}
* {{ratio:1.78}}

[i]Note: colons are supported in place of slashes; e.g., {{ratio:16:9}}.[/i]

[i]Note: using ratios won't always result in pixel perfect results as the ratios are rounded to two decimal points, i.e. a search for {{ratio:16/9}} may result in a picture with the dimensions 1920x1078 instead of 1920x1080.[/i]

h6. Why should you use ratios?

Ratios can be used to assist in finding wallpapers. For example, if you have a 1920x1080 monitor, you can use {{ratio:16/9 width:>=1920}} to find wallpapers for it.

h6. Tip

If you want to avoid calculating ratios altogether, then you can use dimensions directly.

[i]Example:[/i]
{{ratio:1920/1200}} is equivalent to {{ratio:8/5}}

h6. "Basic syntax":[#dtext-basic]

You can use basic syntax with ratios; though, take note if you use fractions.

First, the site will calculate all fractions into a decimal notation and round it off to two decimals, e.g. {{ratio:16:9}} becomes {{ratio:1.78}}.

At this point it's regular numbers and normal basic syntax will work as expected.

[i]Example:[/i]
{{ratio:16/10..16/9}} becomes {{ratio:1.6..1.78}} (Note: 16/9..16/10 won't work. See under Intervals on this page)
{{ratio:..16/9}} becomes {{ratio:..1.78}}

h4. See also

* [[Help:Cheatsheet]] (a complete list of tags and metatags)
* [[Help:Text syntax]]
* [[Help:Array syntax]]
* [[Help:API]]

title: kinomoto_sakura_(cherry_blossom_costume)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in the first movie during her battle against [[Madoushi]].

She wears a [[purple hat]], a [[pink shirt]] with large [[puffy sleeves]], [[white gloves]], a flower-themed [[purple skirt]], a large [[pink bow|pink]] [[back bow]], [[pink pants]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]].

She wears a [[blue hat|blue]] [[jester cap]], a [[blue dress]] beneath a [[blue capelet]] with a large orange star on the front, a [[white coat]] under the capelet, [[blue gloves]], and [[blue thighhighs|blue]] [[thigh boots]].

title: murder
body:
The unlawful or immoral killing of another human (or other sapient being) with the malicious intent of the perpetrator. Does not include killing in a proper [[battle]] or [[duel]], [[accidental_murder|killing by accident]], or [[assisted suicide]].

Pics with this tag depict a character murdering, or having murdered, another. If the murder takes place or is depicted off-screen (not shown), use the [[implied murder]] tag.

h4. See also

* [[Death]]

title: under_the_skin_(2022)
body:
A Chinese crime drama produced by Linmon Pictures. The narrative revolves around a forensic criminal profiler and a detective who meets again after 7 years and proceeds to work together to solve cases while uncovering what happened 7 years ago. 

Not to be confused with the 2013 science fiction film directed by Jonathan Glazer, loosely based on the 2000 novel of the same name by Michel Faber.

title: hard_rock_stadium
body:
A multi-use [[stadium]] in [[Miami]], primarily used as the home field for the [[Miami Dolphins]] [[National Football league|NFL]] team.

A temporary [[racetrack]] is built around the stadium grounds for the [[Formula One]] Miami Grand Prix, integrating parts of the parking lot along with dedicated racing pavement. The circuit is known as the Miami International Autodrome, and is constructed and then disassembled each year, being used solely for the F1 race and it's supporting events.

title: miami
body:
A city in sourthern [[Florida (location)|]] and one of the most popular tourist destinations in the state.

Miami is the inspiration behind the [[Grand Theft Auto]] series' Vice City, and is very closely linked to the [[vaporwave]] aesthetic, thanks to it's use as  setting for the popular 80s cop show [[Miami Vice]]. 

h4. Tagged Landmarks
* [[Hard Rock Stadium]]

title: darkness_(konosuba)
body:
One of the main character in [[kono_subarashii_sekai_ni_shukufuku_wo!|Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!]].

A crusader who valiantly protects her teammates from harm with her own body as much as possible and without regard for her own well-being, even if it is not necessary to do so.

She joins a party consisting of [[Satou Kazuma]], [[Megumin]] and [[Aqua (konosuba)|]].

[spoiler]She is a massive [[masochism|masochist]]. She is offensively useless being unable to damage enemies with her [[sword]] even at point blank range. She joins Kazuma's party because no other party wanted her. Her real name is Lalatina Dustiness Ford, but she gets embarrassed when someone calls her that.[/spoiler]

Darkness has [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] stylized with a [[braid]], [[ponytail]], and [[bangs]].

She wears red [[x hair ornament|x]] [[hair ornament]]s, a [[red ribbon|red]] [[ribbon]], [[black bodysuit]], [[black gloves]], and yellow [[armor]] that includes a [[boobplate]].

title: reaper_(overwatch)
body:
[i]"Death walks among you."[/i]

Real Name: Gabriel Reyes
Age: Unknown
Occupation: Soldier, Mercenary, Terrorist
Country: USA

An offense-class character in [[Overwatch]]. Gabriel Reyes was a decorated soldier, and joined Overwatch with his best friend [[soldier:_76_(overwatch)|Jack Morrison]]. After the Omnic Crisis, the position of strike commander was passed over Reyes and given to Morrison. This created a rift between the two men. At some point, Reyes led a rebellion against Morrison in the Overwatch headquarters, and an explosion took the two of them with it. Reyes eventually resurfaced as the vengeful Reaper, now obsessed with hunting down all former Overwatch agents.

h4. Alternate Skins
* [[Blackwatch Reyes]]
* [[El Blanco Reaper]]
** [[Mariachi Reaper]]

title: star_wars:_legacy
body:
A [[science fiction]] comic in the [[Star Wars]] franchise published by Dark Horse. Legacy is set over 100 years after the events of [b]A New Hope[/b] and primarily follows Cade Skywalker, a descendant of the Skywalkers who gave up the force to become a bounty hunter - but still has visions of his ancestor [[Luke Skywalker]] urging him to reconnect with the force. Due to its setting, the series follows an entirely new cast of characters and features mostly brand new mechanical elements. 

The comic initially ran from 2006 to 2011, and then saw a reboot in 2012 that followed the great-granddaughter of [[Han Solo]] and [[Princess Leia]]. The reboot ran until 2014, when it was canceled and the entire series decanonized following [[Disney]]'s acquisition of the franchise.

H1. Characters
* [[Darth Talon]]

title: qinghua_(porcelain)
body:
A type of Chinese ceramic art; known alternately as 'Blue and white pottery' in English, as it predominantly uses blue and white dye.

A Japanese offshoot of qinghua is [i]arita yaki[/i] (arita ware).

It also inspired [i]Delftware[/i], a kind Dutch tin-glazed earthenware.

* !post #3971173
* !post #5786647

title: year_of_the_rooster
body:
Every 12 years there is a [b]Year of the Rooster[/b], beginning at Chinese New Year. Years of the Rooster include 1933, 1945, 1957, 1969, 1981, [[1993]], [[2005]], [[2017]], and 2029. 

The Rooster is tenth of the 12 animals in the Chinese zodiac cycle. A year of the Rooster always comes after a [[year of the monkey|Monkey year]] and before a [[year of the dog|Dog year]].

Artists may portray [[chicken girl]]s or females dressed up as [[chicken]]s since chickens are simply female roosters.

h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]
* [[Rooster]]

title: chicken_girl
body:
A [[bird girl]], [[half-harpy]] or [[harpy]] that has [[chicken]] (chick, [[rooster]] or hen) features. Rooster girls may for example have red rooster combs atop their heads and a sickle feathers. Hen girls may be all white in feathers with red wattles. Chick girls are most commonly yellow, like baby chickens.

Chicken girls are common in [[year of the rooster]] images.

title: killer_in_the_mirror
body:
"On that day, we were friends."

The free school "Mebuki no Sono" was a place for boys and girls who, for various reasons, couldn't fit into regular schools.
One day, the protagonist, Tsuruya, and his classmates who attend there decide to have a 2-day, 1-night camp at Mebuki.
Tsuruya and his friends were having a good time, but due to a landslide caused by heavy rain, Mebuki no Sono becomes isolated. When a mysterious figure wearing a cat mask appears, the worst night begins...

Created with RPG Maker MV, a replayable exploration ADV game.

title: sode
body:
Sode (袖) or tousei sode (当世袖) are the [[samurai]] armor's equivalent of [[pauldrons]].  They are are large, rectangular shoulder pieces made from overlapping iron and/or leather plates, tied together by leather cord.

Sode can be constructed to be relatively flexible or rigid and may cover the just the shoulders or most of the arm down to the elbow.

h4. See also
* [[single sode]]
* [[pauldrons]]
* [[shoulder pads]]
* [[japanese clothes]]
* [[kusazuri]], a similarly constructed skirt of lamellar plates covering the upper legs.
* [[List of armor]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (JP): 当世具足":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/当世具足]
* "Wikipedia: Japanese armour":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_armour]

title: assassin's_creed_ii
body:
The second game of the [[assassin's_creed_(series)|Assassin's Creed]] series. It takes place in [[Renaissance]] Italy. [[Ezio Auditore da Firenze]], after finding his father and two of his brothers dead in a political plot, finds out that his father was an Assassin, and seeks revenge on those responsible.

In the modern day, [[Desmond Miles]] manages to escape Abstergo with the help of [[Lucy Stillman]]. He then meets a team of modern assassins, and uses a new [[Animus]] to relive the memories of Ezio in order to thwart Abstergo's plot to control the world.

title: connor_kenway
body:
Protagonist of [[Assassin's Creed III]].

[b]Ratonhnhaké:ton[/b] (1756 – unknown), often known by the adopted name of [b]Connor[/b], was a "Kanien'kehá:ka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohawk_people Assassin during the period of the American Revolutionary War, and is an ancestor of [[Desmond Miles]], through the paternal line.

Ratonhnhaké:ton was born to the Templar [[Haytham Kenway]] and [[Kaniehti:io|Kaniehtí:io]], a Kanien'kehá:ka woman from the village of Kanatahséton.

His garment resembles the army uniform used during the [[American Revolution]] but has undergone several changes, including a noticeable [[hood]].

title: h&k_psg1
body:
The [b]PSG1[/b] ([i][b]P[/b]räzisions[b]s[/b]chützen[b]g[/b]ewehr[/i], "precision shooting [[rifle]]") is a German 7.62×51mm NATO semi-automatic [b][[sniper rifle]][/b] developed by [[Heckler & Koch]] in 1972, based on the earlier [[H&K G3|G3]] design.
Visual features of this [[weapon]] are a [[scope]], an adjustable buttstock with a cheek piece, a [[bipod]] and a pistol grip with distinct palm shelf on the bottom.

title: h&k_p30
body:
The [b]P30[/b] is a polymer-framed [b][[handgun]][/b] manufactured by [[Heckler & Koch]], available in 9×19mm and .40 S&W.
The [[gun]] can be recognized by its small rounded hammer, dovetail rear sight, angular trigger guard, finger grooves, railed dust cover and large diagonal serrations. 

It is the [[weapon]] of choice of [[Kayoko (blue archive)|]] from [[Blue Archive]] as well as [[John Wick (character)|]] (P30L variant with a [[compensator]]).

title: sharingan
body:
A specific eye from [i][[Naruto]][/i] series.

The Sharingan (literally meaning: Copy Wheel Eye, meaning (Viz): Mirror Wheel Eye) is the dōjutsu kekkei genkai of the Uchiha clan that appears selectively among its members.

It is regarded as one of the "Three Great Dōjutsu", the others being the [[Byakugan]] and the [[Rinnegan]].

While its powers originated from [[Ootsutsuki Kaguya]]'s [[Rinne Sharingan]], its independent form was first manifested by [[Ootsutsuki Indra]].

title: shrug_(clothing)
body:
A type of garment consisting of only sleeves. They are usually worn on top of another shirt, but they are often drawn as a sort of [[lingerie]] or plain shirt in art depicting them.

Different from [[detached sleeves]] in that the sleeves are connected to eachother. They go past the shoulder and are typically connected in the back, but they can also be connected through a [[turtleneck]].

Use [[collared shrug]] as well if applicable. 

h4. See also

title: iphone_x
body:
[[Apple Inc.|Apple]]'s 11th-generation flagship [[iPhone]], unveiled and first put on sale in 2017. Identified by a glass and stainless-steel form factor as well as a bezel-less, rounded front display with only a sensor-housing "notch" along the top edge, and no "home button". The back features two cameras in a black, vertical, pill-shaped enclosure, with a flashlight in between.

Visually identical to the 12th-generation iPhone XS and iPhone XS Max.

If it has a flat-edged chassis instead of a round one, it's [[iPhone 12]] or [[iPhone 12 Pro]].

h4. Examples
* !asset #21493268: iPhone X
* !asset #21493266: iPhone XS

h4. See also

* [[iPhone 11]]
* [[iPhone 11 Pro]]

title: iphone_14_pro
body:
[[Apple Inc.]]'s 16th generation [[iPhone]]. The iPhone 15 Pro is visually similar, the only differences being slightly thinner bezels and colors based on titanium.

h4. From the front

Features the "Dynamic Island":[https://support.apple.com/en-ca/guide/iphone/iph28f50d10d/ios] instead of a notch. The screen is trimmed with black, silver, gold, or purple.

h4. From the back

Like [[iPhone 13 Pro]], but purple.

h4. Example
* !asset #21493135: iPhone 14 Pro
* !asset #21493197: iPhone 15 Pro

title: iphone_13
body:
Visually identical to [[iPhone 12]], but the two rear cameras are arranged diagonally instead of vertically.

Comes in green, blue, pink, black, white, and red. Visually identical to iPhone 14, which also comes in black, white, and red, but also light blue, light purple, and yellow.

If it has three cameras, it's [[iPhone 13 Pro]] or [[iPhone 14 Pro]].

h4. Examples
* !asset #21493096: iPhone 13
* !asset #21493173: iPhone 14

title: iphone_13_pro
body:
Use this instead of [[iPhone 12 Pro]] when:

* the model is explicitly stated (post #5328256)
* the phone is dark green or light blue, colours new to this model
* the camera housing is 25% larger than [[iPhone 12]] Pro (post #5364029).

The distance from the bottom of the camera square to the max height of the Apple logo is half the height of the camera square, i.e., if the camera square is 100px tall, then there should be 50px to the top of the leaf of the Apple logo. Generally, if it looks like there's barely enough room for two squares, it's this model; if there's definitely room, it's [[iPhone 12 Pro]].

This model does not have a dark blue version.

h4. Example and non-example
* !asset #21493098: iPhone 13 Pro
* !asset #21493048: [[iPhone 12 Pro]]

title: iphone_12_pro
body:
Like [[iphone 12|iPhone 12]], but with three cameras.

Visually identical to iPhone 12 Pro Max.

h4. Differences from [[iphone 11 pro|iPhone 11 Pro]]

* LiDAR scanner in the triple camera housing on the back (a large black dot behind the glass)
* smaller rear-facing microphone (a black hole in the glass)
* decidedly flat-edged chassis, as opposed to a round-edged one

The colored finish of the phone borders the display and is usually much more visible from front (dark grey or dark blue example in post #4287775).
The phone is typically a dark grey, dark blue, silver, or gold finish.

h4. Example
* !asset #21493048

title: iphone_12
body:
Like [[iPhone 11]], but with a decidedly flat-edged chassis, as opposed to a round-edged one, with the colored finish of the phone clearly bordering the display from the front.

Visually identical to iPhone 12 mini.

If the two cameras on the back are arranged diagonally instead of vertically, it's [[iPhone 13]].
If there are three cameras on the back, use [[iPhone 12 Pro]] instead.

h4. Distinguishing from other models when only the front is visible

If the finish is typically white, black, blue, green, purple, or red, it's likely [[iPhone 12]].
If the finish is graphite, silver, gold, or pacific blue, it's likely [[iPhone 12 Pro]].
If there is no colored trim and the edges seem rounded, use [[iPhone X]] instead.

h4. Example 
* !asset #21493042

title: iphone_11_pro
body:
Apple's 13th-generation flagship [[iphone|iPhone]], unveiled and first put on sale in 2019. Use only when the "distinct triple cameras":https://www.apple.com/ca/iphone-11-pro/specs/ on the back of the phone are visible, or if "iPhone 11 Pro" is explicitly mentioned.  Often used to show that a character is wealthy or high-class.

Visually identical to iPhone 11 Pro Max, as the size of the phone is ambiguous.

If there are just two cameras, use [[iphone 11]] instead.
If only the bezel-less front display is visible, use [[iphone x]] instead.

h4. Example
* !asset #21493037

title: iphone_11
body:
Apple's lower-end 13th-generation [[iphone|iPhone]], unveiled and first put on sale in 2019. Identified by two cameras in a vertical layout and a flashlight on the right, enclosed within a rounded square on the back of the phone. Also features a centered [[apple inc.|Apple]] logo (or [[logo parody]]) and no "iPhone" text like previous models.

If there are three cameras, use [[iphone 11 pro]] instead.

If only the bezel-less front display is visible, use [[iphone x]] instead.  
If the chassis is clearly flat-edged, use [[iphone 12]].

h4. Example
* !asset #21493026

title: sesame_ball
body:
There are a variety of pastries that consists of a ball coated in sesame. Some dishes include are:

[b]Jiandui[/b]
A fried [[Chinese food|Chinese pastry]] made from glutinous rice flour. Called "Goma dango" in Japanese; 'butsui' in the Philippines; 'gato zinzli' in Creole.
The hollow of the pastry is filled with a filling usually consisting of lotus paste, or alternatively, sweet black bean paste, or red bean paste.

[b]Bánh rán[/b]
Vietnamese dish. Deep-fried dough, sometimes coated in sesame.

title: toyosatomimi_no_miko
body:
The "Shoutoku Taoist". Stage 6 boss of the 13th [[Touhou]] game, [[Ten Desires]], and later a playable character in [[Hopeless Masquerade]], [[Urban Legend In Limbo]] and [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]] in which she dons a [[cape]].

She wears [[earmuffs]] (which are sometimes depicted as [[headphones]]), has a [[pointy hair]] style, holds a [[ritual baton]], and carries a [[sword]]. Japanese fans assume it is "七星剣 ([i]Shichi-sei Ken[/i], Big Dipper Sword)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/七星剣], one of [[Shoutoku Taishi]]'s two famous swords. Its design was influenced by Taoism.

She is often depicted as having a peculiar taste in aesthetics because of the design of the [[New Mask of Hope]].

body: Tableturf Battle is an in-universe collectible card game inspired by Turf War battles but turn-based and designed for two players. The mode was introduced in Splatoon 3.

body:
A type of [[dumpling]] commonly eaten in China and other parts of East Asia. 

It has various regional various names and recipes:

Qīngtuán (青团) is a form of [[dumpling]] that is green, common throughout Chinese cuisine. It is made of glutinous [[rice]] mixed with Chinese mugwort or barley grass. This is then usually filled with sweet red or black [[red bean paste]].

title: cepheus_(constellation)
body:
Cepheus is a [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. It is named after the ancient king of Ethiopia, Cepheus, husband of [[Cassiopeia (constellation)|]] and father of [[Andromeda (constellation)|]] in Greek mythology. Its brightest star is Alderamin.

Cepheus resembles a child's drawing of a house, i.e. a square with a triangle on top. The line between the two figures is often omitted.

h5. Example shapes
* !asset #21477712
* !asset #21477713
* !asset #21477714
* !asset #21477715

h5. Example posts
* post #2287119, upper left corner
* post #3797347, below girl's breast
* post #4882158, leftmost

h5. Neighboring constellations
* [[Camelopardalis (constellation)|]]
* [[Cassiopeia (constellation)|]]
* [[Cygnus (constellation)|]]
* [[Draco (constellation)|]]
* [[Lacerta (constellation)|]]
* [[Ursa Minor (constellation)|]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Cepheus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cepheus_(constellation)

title: firecrackers
body:
A small cylindrical [[explosive]] used to create noise invented in ancient China, it comes in both single pack and in strings. A very common and popular tradition to celebrate the [[Chinese New Year]], often alongside [[fireworks]]. This practice is said to originate from the legend of [[Nian (mythology)|]], a beast who harasses villages during New Year that is scared of loud noises. It's also used as decorations, in forms of strings hanging on the walls.

* !post #6207195

title: mkb42
body:
The [b]Mkb42[/b] ([i]Maschinenkarabiner 42[/i] "machine carbine model 1942") was an early German [[assault rifle]] designed in 1940-1941 during [[World War II]]. It was initially designed by Walther, hence it was known as Maschinenkarabiner 42(W) or Mkb42(W). The more successful one was designed by Haenel, hence Maschinenkarabiner 42(H) or Mkb42(H). Chambered in 7.92×33mm Kurz, both were predecessors of the famous [[Stg44]].

Visually speaking, the Mkb42 has longer, thicker gas tube that extends above the barrel compared to StG44.
* !post #6007844

h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[StG45]]
h1.External links

title: bursting_ass
body: Similar to [[bursting_breasts]], bursting ass is used when some degree of [[wardrobe_malfunction]] is caused due to the clothing being too small for the ass in question. That, or the clothes appear small/[[tight clothes|tight]] enough to be about to “burst” off of the ass. This tag is not to be used just because the clothing over the ass (like shorts or pants, for example) are torn. It should be apparent that the wardrobe malfunction is caused primarily by the butt being too big for whatever clothing the character is wearing.

title: square-end_necktie
body:
A [[necktie]] that features ends that are cut straight across, creating a square or rectangular shape at the bottom, as opposed to the more prevalent pointed or angled ends found on traditional neckties.

Square-end neckties are often associated with a more modern or trendy style and are sometimes worn to add a unique touch to an outfit. However, they are generally less common than the classic pointed-end necktie.

title: chest_rig
body:
A [b]chest rig[/b] is a piece of tactical gear consisting of multiple pouches that is worn on the [[upper body]] to hold various items, such as [[magazine (weapon)|magazines]], [[walkie-talkie]], [[combat knife]], and other useful tools. Typically strapped on using a harness system. It is separate from any clothing article. Intially designed for [[military]] and [[police]] during combat, chest rig has been adopted for civilian use - especially ones designed with a single [[pouch]].

h6. How to distinguish
* !post #5400538: [b]Chest rig[/b]. Pouches are separate from clothing article, situated on the torso/chest.
* !post #7001003:  [[Load bearing vest]]. Pouches are integrated with the tactical vest.
* !post #5944716: [[Load bearing equipment]]. Situated around the waist, the gear may consist more than just [[ammunition pouch]]es.

h1. See also
* [[holster]]
* [[military uniform]]
* [[bulletproof vest]]
* [[scabbard]]
* [[sheath]]
* [[tactical clothes]]

title: load_bearing_vest
body:
A type of [[vest]] worn by [[military]] [[soldier|personnel]], [[police]] officers and [[military operator|special forces]] in combat. It contains integrated [[ammunition pouch]]es, slots for grenades or other equipment, and sometimes a built-in [[holster]].
May overlap with [[bulletproof vest]] due to some vests that enables the insertion of [[body armor|armor]] plates. Especially if the front side look flat and stiff.
h6. How to distinguish
* !post #7001003: [b]Load bearing vest[/b]. Pouches are integrated with the vest.
* !post #5400538: [[Chest rig]]. Pouches are separate from clothing article, situated on the torso/chest.
* !post #5944716: [[Load bearing equipment]]. Worn around the waist, the gear may consist more than just ammunition pouches.

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]
* [[tactical clothes]]

title: avs-36
body:
The [B]AVS-36[/b] is a Soviet [[battle rifle]] chambered in 7.62×54mmR cartridge, designed by Sergei Simonov. It was used in limited quantity during early years of the World War II. 
Compared to its semi-auto only successors like the [[SVT-38]] it had prominently larger [[muzzle device]] and a single perforated metal heat shield on the top that covers its gas piston assembly.

h1. See also
* [[Fedorov Avtomat]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h1. External links
* Wikipedia: "AVS-36":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AVS-36

title: h&k_hk21
body:
The [b]HK21[/b] is a West German 7.62×51mm NATO [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] general-purpose [[machine gun]], developed in 1961 by [[Heckler & Koch]]. Its design is based on the [[H&K G3|G3]] platform, the closed bolt roller-delayed blowback. The [[weapon]] is in use with the armed forces of several Asian, African and Latin American countries.

The [[HK21 (girls' frontline)|]] also accepts 20-round detachable [[ammunition box]] or 50-round [[drum magazine]]. An 80-round and 100-round drum [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] was also available (no longer manufactured).

h1. See also
* [[H&K HK23]] [tn](Lighter variant)[/tn]
* [[List of Weapons]]
h1. External links
* Wikipedia: "Heckler & Koch HK21":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heckler_%26_Koch_HK21]

title: luger_p08
body:
The [b]Luger P08[/b] is a German semi-automatic [[handgun]] that saw use in both [[World War I]] and [[World War II]]. Other than its iconic appearance, the P08 uses a complex toggle-lock mechanism. It was the very first [[handgun]] chambered in popular 9×19mm Parabellum [[ammunition|round]]. 

The [[p08_(girls'_frontline)|Luger P08]] can also be fitted with a long barrel and a drum magazine. This tag is also applicable to its full auto variant ([b]Artillery Luger[/b]) that has those features, often fitted with a [[shoulder stock]]. The handgun became highly-prized war trophies by Allied soldiers. 

h4. See also
* [[Borchardt C-93]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
h1. External links
* Wikipedia: "Luger pistol":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luger_pistol

title: code_lyoko
body:
Code Lyoko is a French animated series created by Thomas Romain and Tania Palumbo. 
It features both traditional animation to represent events in the real world and CGI to represent the world of Lyoko. Various Books and comics also exist for the show.

It follows a group of high school students as they combat a hostile A.I. program in the virtual world known as Lyoko.

A live action show was later created, called [[Code Lyoko Evolution]], which took place a year after the animated show. While Live Action replaced the traditional animation, CGI was still used to represent Lyoko.

h4. Characters

h5. Lyoko Warriors
* [[Jeremie Belpois]]
* [[Aelita]]
* [[Odd Della Robbia]]
* [[Ulrich Stern]]
* [[Ishiyama Yumi]]
* [[William Dunbar]]
* [[Laura Gauthier]]

h5. Lyoko Characters
* [[Xana (code lyoko)|]]
* [[Franz Hopper]]

title: sixshot_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Sixshot[/b] is an evil [i]Six changer[/i] [[Decepticon]], a very powerful green and silver sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a [[cybertron]]ian fighter jet, a cybertronian car, an energy gun, a flying robotic wolf and a cybertronian tank.

He is one of the few transformers that can transform into Six (Seven) different modes. He was then later to change into an Heroic [[Autobot]] known as Greatshot (his upgraded form) in Transformers Victory.

Motto: [i]"Life is worth living only as long as there are enemies worth destroying...".[/i]

title: duff_beer
body:
Duff Beer is a fictional brand of [[Beer]] from [[The Simpsons]]. A parody of many American Lager Beers that were cheap and poor quality, it is the common favorite drink of [[Homer Simpson]] and his friends. In the Simpsons universe, the brand not only comes in regular Duff Beer but also has other variations made with different crops or higher quality ingredients than regular Duff Beer.

Despite being fictional, Duff Beer has been sold in real life, either illegally or officially approved by the companies that own the Simpsons.

title: fig_leaf
body:
The leaf of a fig tree. Commonly used as a censor of the genitals in statues or paintings around the middle ages, sometimes applied to already existing statues or paintings, it has also become an idiom for obscuring things.

title: nissan_240rs
body:
A purpose-built [[rally car]] designed by [[Nissan]] for the [[World Rally Championship]]'s Group B ruleset with a roadgoing counterpart for homologation compliance. The 240RS competed from 1983 to 1986 and was based on the S110 generation Silvia.

Not to be confused with the Nissan 240SX, which was the name used for the [[Nissan 180SX]] and several [[Nissan Silvia]] generations in North America.

title: toned_female
body:
A female character with an athletic body while not being overly [[muscular]]. Toned females are neither bulky or slim and sit just in the middle between muscular and non-athletic.

Toned females lean closer to their feminine side with visible muscles.

* !post #6005007
* !post #7387759
* !post #7426737
* !post #7469016

h4. Examples

h6. [u] Belly [/u]

* !post #4446835
* !post #7447733
* !post #7378678
* !post #1894485

h6. [u] Abs [/u]

[[Toned]] abs and [[muscular]] abs are 2 distinctly different things. Usually [[toned]] abs don't depict a female with a bulky body and leans closer to their feminine side.
Don't get confused with [[linea_alba|linea alba]]

title: mona_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Hydro [[Genshin Impact]] character.

A mysterious young astrologer who proclaims herself to be "Astrologist Mona Megistus," and who possesses abilities to match the title. Erudite, but prideful. Though she is often strapped for cash and lives a life of thrift, she is resolved to never use astrology for profit... It is this very resolution that has caused her to constantly fret about money.

Sometimes drawn gathering or eating [[mushroom]]s, which are a required in-game material to level her up.

title: non-web_source
body:
A post whose source is plain text, rather than a link to the website where it originally came from.

This includes file uploads, where the source is simply the filename used by the uploader, and posts where the source is a written description of where the image came from. Written descriptions are often used for [[scan]]s, [[self-upload]]s or [[commissioner upload]]s, and [[game CG]]s or other assets datamined from a game.

Non-web sources should be avoided whenever possible. If you obtained the image from a website, you should post a link to the website where you obtained the image.

This tag is added automatically. Unsourced posts aren't included under this tag.

h4.See also

* [[imageboard desourced]]
* [[scan]]
* [[source request]]

title: suntiang
body:
An elaborate crown, worn normally by Minangkabau women in Sumatra for festive occasions. 

It's fan-shaped and typically made from metals, like brass or copper.

May also be called a [i]pasumandan[/i] when referring to suntiangs worn by dancers. 
Likewise, when worn by a bride, it is called a [i]suntiang gadang[/i].

title: rpd
body:
The [b]RPD[/b] (Russian: РПД, ручной пулемёт Дегтярёва [Degtyaryov hand-held [[machine gun]]]) is a [[Soviet]] [b][[light machine gun]][/b], fed from an [[ammunition belt]] contained in a [[ammunition box|drum container]]. Chambered in intermediate 7.62×39mm [[ammunition|cartridge]], it is the precursor of modern squad automatic [[weapon]]s. It is usually equipped with a [[bipod]], fixed wooden stock and handguard. The weapon was created as a replacement for the [[DP-27|DP machine gun]]. Both weapons were designed by "Vasily Degtyaryov":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vasily_Degtyaryov]. 

Although the [[RPD (girls' frontline)|]] was ready for mass production during the final stages of [[World War II]] in 1944, it was adopted in 1948. In 1960s, the [[RPK]] largely replaced it in [[Soviet army|Soviet military]] service. The RPD converted into 5.56×45mm NATO was used by [[Israel]] in limited quantity.

h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[PPD-40]]
* [[PTRD-41]]

title: layout_plan
body:
A type of [[map]], drawn with a certain perspective (usually [[from above]]) in order to highlight the position of a [[building]], structure(s), of which the projects are completed but not the constructions, on a construction site. 
Layout plans are drawn at a certain scale and do not demonstrate the interiors of buildings, but rather all exterior elements surrounding the buildings in detail. [[Road]]s, [[tree]]s, [[utility pole]]s, [[power lines]] and et cetera in the project area can also be represented.

title: kk_62
body:
The [b]KK 62[/B] is a Finnish [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] [[light machine gun]] chambered in 7.62×39mm [[ammunition|cartridge]]. Designed in the 1950s, it was officially adopted as the standard infantry support weapon of the Finnish Defence Forces in 1962 as the [i]7.62 konekivääri 62.[/i]

title: lasagne
body:
Lasagne (UK) or lasagna (US) is a dish made of very wide, flat sheets of [[pasta]] with multiple layers of meat, sauce, and cheese stacked on top of one another.

<tn>In Italian, "lasagna" refers to one flat sheet of pasta and its plural form, "lasagne", refers to the dish. This distinction is also observed in English, but only rarely in American English. ("Wiktionary":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/lasagna])

title: fubuki_(senran_kagura)
body:
A character who debuts in [[Senran Kagura New Link]]. She is the hybrid child of a human male shinobi and a female Yōma. 

Originally the antagonist, she eventually turns around and becomes a supporting ally to the cast.

Fubuki has [[pale skin|pale pure white skin]] and [[black eyes|dead cold black eyes]] with shadows under them. She possesses [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] black hair tied in long [[twintails|twin tails]] decorated by a [[white flower]].

In her shinobi clothes, she wears revealing [[black kimono]] clothes mixed with an ankle-lengthened loincloth all lined with gold that reveals her chest and legs, and two small white flowers on her neck and the middle of her chest while the shoulder area has with black stripe straps on both shoulder in which the straps are actually stockings. Like [[yumi (senran kagura)|Yumi]] she uses a [[Fan]] as her weapon, but the mobile game gives it a feathered appearance while the anime simply made it a black version of Yumi's weapon.

Her seiyuu is [[Asumi Kana]]

Hair Color: Black
Eye Color: Black
Height: 170 cm (5'7)
Three Sizes
B95-W:68-H:88
Cup: I

title: tuxedo_cat
body:
A pattern of black/grey and white coating for domestic [[cat]]s, where the upper body is covered in black fur while the lower body (including but not limited to: nose, chin, chest, belly and paws) are white, appears as if the cat is wearing a tuxedo suit.

Two tuxedo cats became fairly popular in [[meme]]s, those being [[Maxwell the Cat]] of [[Spinning Cat (meme)|]] fame, and [[Uni (cat)|]] of Big Boobs fame. Only tag either if it can be explicitly confirmed that the cat in question is one or the other, otherwise stick with this tag only.

title: yagen_toushirou
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. A [[tantou]] crafted by Awataguchi, and thus one of the many Toushirou brothers. 

In 1493, [[Hatakeyama Masanaga]] tried to commit hara-kiri using this dagger, but he couldn't cut deep into his flesh. He got angry and threw the dagger, and then the dagger pierced directly through a yagen (a stone mill for medicinal herbs). The dagger gained the reputation for never damaging its master but sharp. That's responsible for its name. He was also owned by [[Oda Nobunaga]] at one point. It's said that Yagen was burned down at the Honnō-ji Incident with Nobunaga.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. His standard outfit is a [[military uniform]], a [[necktie]] and [[black gloves]]. For his Internal Affairs outfit, he wears [[glasses]], a [[lab coat]] and [[suspenders]]. For both outfits he wears [[shorts]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

Known for being very mature and reliable, and having a very deep voice despite his youthful appearance. Of course, artists tend to portray him as a precocious kid. Either that, or he's presented as a reliable big brother for the other Awataguchi school tantous when [[ichigo hitofuri|Ichigo]] is away, as he's the only one of them in-game that's been used in combat prior to personification. For this reason he's known as "Aniki" outside of game.

title: goodsmile_racing
body:
GOODSMILE Racing is a race team and subsidiary of [[GOODSMILE Company]]. The team participates in [[Super GT]]'s GT300 class and has made one-off appearances at the [[Intercontinental GT Challenge]]'s [[circuit de spa-francorchamps|24 Hours of Spa]]. The team currently uses a [[Mercedes-Benz AMG GT]], and fielded the [[Porsche 911]] and [[BMW Z4]] in previous seasons.

Their mascot is [[Racing Miku]], who has a new design released each year. The team's real life [[race queen]]s are known as the "Racing Miku Supporters" and wear outfits based on the Racing Miku design of the year.

title: mg3
body:
A 7.62×51mm NATO derivative of the German [[MG42]], which was adopted by the Bundeswehr. This [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] [[machine gun|general-purpose]] [b][[machine gun]][/b] was designed in 1959 and mainly produced by Rheinmetall AG.
Albeit visually similar to the earlier MG42, its usage context is for modern, post-World War II setting. The MG3 typically comes in all-black or desert tan finish, accessories such as an open [[barrel shroud]], optics, carry handle, and Picatinny rail.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[MG3 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: MG3 machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MG_3_machine_gun

title: sig_mg338
body:
A [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] [b][[machine gun]][/b] manufactured by [[SIG Sauer]], chambered for ".338 Norma Magnum":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.338_Norma_Magnum [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]]. It was intended to bridge the firepower gap between the 7.62x51mm NATO [[machine gun]] and the [[heavy machine gun|heavier]] [[Browning M2]]. 
The SIG Sauer MG 338 features a quick-change barrel, an [[AR-15]]-style adjustable [[folding stock]], and usually seen with a proprietary [[suppressor]].


h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[MG338 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "ModernFirearms.net":https://modernfirearms.net//machineguns/u-s-a-machineguns/sig-sauer-mg-338-2/
* "Wikipedia: SIG MG 338":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sig_MG_338

title: fn_mag
body:
The [b]FN MAG[/b] ([i]Mitrailleuse d'Appui Général[/i]) is an open-bolt, gas-operated 7.62×51mm NATO [[machine gun]] designed in the early 1950s at [[FN Herstal]] by Ernest Vervier. In use by over 80 countries, and manufactured under license in many countries, such as Argentina, Egypt, India, Singapore, the United Kingdom and the United States (as the [b]M240[/b]). 

h1. See also
* [[FN Minimi]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h1. External links
* "FN Herstal website":https://fnherstal.com/en/defence/portable-weapons/fn-mag/
* "Wikipedia: FN MAG":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FN_MAG

title: h&k_mg5
body:
The [b]MG5[/b] is an open bolt German [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] [[machine gun|general-purpose]] [b][[machine gun]][/b] manufactured by [[Heckler & Koch]]. Formerly known as the HK121, it was designed in 2001 in order to supplant the MG3, and was adopted in 2015 by the Bundeswehr.
The MG5 typically comes in desert tan finish, has perforated upper heatshield and its fixed buttstock shape looks similar to the FN Minimi one.

h1. See also
* [[H&K MG4]] [tn](Lighter 5.56mm NATO predecessor)[/tn]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[MG5 (Girls' Frontline)]] 

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Heckler & Koch MG5":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heckler_%26_Koch_MG5

title: kac_lamg
body:
The KAC Light Assault [[Machine Gun]] (LAMG) is a 5.56×45mm [b][[light machine gun]][/b] system developed by Eugene Stoner and manufactured by Knight's Armament Company (KAC). It is the evolution of the [[Stoner 63]] concept. 
The AMG is the [[machine gun|GPMG]] variant chambered for 7.62×51mm NATO or 6.5 Creedmoor.

h1. See also

title: jujube_(fruit)
body: The jujube (scientific name: Ziziphus jujuba), commonly known as red dates, black dates, or Chinese dates, is a small deciduous tree that grows in temperate regions. It is native to central and southern mainland China, the Korean Peninsula, Lebanon, Iran, Pakistan, India, and Bangladesh, and is distributed in various regions of China. Due to its economic value, it has been transplanted to Japan, southern Europe, and North America. The small flowers are rich in nectar, making it a source of honey. The fruit is called jujube, which is oblong in shape. When immature, it is greenish-yellow, resembling a miniature version of green Indian dates, and turns reddish-brown when ripe. Jujubes can be eaten fresh or dried, and can also be made into dried fruits or candied.

body:
[i]Kote[/i] are Japanese arm & [[shoulder armor]], a form of armored sleeve usually covering from the forearms all the way to the shoulder.  They are typically made by stitching many small plates into a padded sleeve.

[i]Kote[/i] that only cover the forearms are called [i]han kote[/i], and are also covered by this tag.

[i][[Kurokote]][/i] are a subtype of [i]kote[/i], usually made from black iron plates, which give them their color and name.

title: gainax
body:
[b]Gainax Company, Limited[/b] (株式会社ガイナックス, [i]Kabushiki-gaisha Gainakkusu[/i]) was a Japanese anime studio famous for works such as [[Honneamise No Tsubasa]], [[Top Wo Nerae!]], [[fushigi no umi no nadia|Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water]], [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], [[FLCL]] and [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]] which have gone on to critical acclaim and commercial success, as well as for their association with award-winning anime director and studio co-founder [[Anno Hideaki]]. The company was headquartered in Koganei, Tokyo, before moving to Mitaka, Tokyo.

The studio was formed in the early 1980s as [[Daicon]] Film by university students [[Anno Hideaki]], [[Sadamoto Yoshiyuki]], Yamaga Hiroyuki, [[Akai Takami]], Okada Toshio, Takeda Yasuhiro, and [[Higuchi Shinji]]. Their first project was to make an animated short for the 20th Annual Japan National SF Convention, also known as [[Daicon III]], held in 1981 in Osaka, Japan. The group made a much bigger splash at the 22nd Annual Japan National SF Convention, [[Daicon IV]], in 1983.

The Daicon IV short firmly established Daicon Film as a talented new anime studio. The studio changed its name to Gainax in 1985, basing the term 'Gainax' on an obscure Tottori Prefecture term for 'giant' and the English suffix 'x'.

Since Gainax originated as a group of fans, it was known for maintaining ties to the general [[otaku]] community, allowing doujinshi of its work, fan-made action figures, and promoting series like Evangelion at private festivals and so on.

Until Neon Genesis Evangelion, Gainax typically worked on stories created in-house, but the studio increasingly developed anime adaptations of existing manga like [[Kareshi Kanojo no Jijou]] and [[Mahoromatic]].

The Animage Anime Grand Prix has been awarded to Gainax for Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water in 1991, Neon Genesis Evangelion in 1995 and 1996, and [[The End of Evangelion]] in 1997.

Much of Gainax's former staff and series left Gainax starting in the late 2000s; notably Anno Hideaki formed [[Studio Khara]] and obtained the rights to Evangelion, several staff members (including those involved in [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]]) left to make [[Trigger (company)|Studio Trigger]], and Gainax sold their rights to FLCL to I.G. Production. [[gonzo (studio)|Gonzo]] is also made of former Gainax staff, having left in the early 90s.

On May 29, 2024, Gainax filed for bankruptcy with the Tokyo District Court, which was publicly announced over one week later on June 7. The remainder of its properties were split between the various Gainax splinter companies and former staff previously mentioned.

title: palace_athene
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]PMX-001 Palace Athene[/b]

A custom, one-off [[mobile suit]] designed by [[Paptimus Scirocco]] of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. While large and capable of loading long range high-powered armament, it suffered in the mobility department.

[spoiler]The unit was piloted by [[Sarah Zabiarov]] and then the AEUG traitor [[Reccoa Londe]]. It was destroyed during the final battle of The Gryps War at the hands of [[Yazan Gable]] and the [[Hambrabi]], mortally wounding [[Emma Sheen]] (who exited her [[Gundam Mk II]] MS so she could check [[Reccoa Londe]]'s condition).[/spoiler]

title: metropolis
body:
[b]Metropolis[/b] ([i]Metoroporisu[/i]) is a classic [[science fiction]] manga created by [[Tezuka Osamu]] and released in 1949. It was adapted into an anime movie in 2001.

The original manga was loosely inspired by a classic 1927 German silent sci-fi movie also called [[Metropolis (fritz_lang)|]]. 

Its anime adaptation, however, was more heavily influenced by the plot of the German film. It was directed by Rintaro, written by [[Ootomo Katsuhiro]] and produced by Madhouse with conceptual support from Tezuka Productions.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolis_(manga)

title: izumi_noa
body:
A fictional [[policewoman]] from near future [[Japan]].

The bubbly, perky [[tomboy]]ish, red-headed gamine labor [[otaku]] from Hokkaidō. The main character of [[kidou_keisatsu_patlabor|Patlabor]], officer [b]Noa Izumi[/b] is usually at the center of the action. Noa loves her labor much like a pet and named it [[alphonse_(av-98_ingram)|"Alphonse"]], a name previously held by a [[pet]] [[dog]] and a pet [[cat]], respectively. 

She's somewhat impulsive, albeit not nearly as much as [[oota_isao|Oota]]. Noa is arguably the best [[mecha]] [[pilot]] in Division 2, although both [[kanuka_clancy|Clancy]] and [[kumagami_takeo|Kumagami]] have shown extreme talent as well but seldom pilot. She has a natural affinity for labors and gets 110% out of them, much to the amazement of her colleagues. Furthermore, she can drink quite a bit more than her co-workers, and recovers from hangovers much faster, since her family runs a liquor store.

This tag is for male admirals only. See [[female admiral (kancolle)|Female Admiral]] for female depictions of the admiral. 

The iteration of the admiral in the second [[Kantai Collection]] anime series: "Itsuka Ano Umi de" (いつかあの海で) is nicknamed [[Admiral Narita (Kancolle)|]].

body:

According to "his profile":[/posts/2872216], he used to be a major in the army before being seconded to the navy (making him a lieutenant commander now). He came into command over a newly established base for training shipgirls with ground-combat capabilities.

Notable for "having personally participated in building his base from scratch":[/posts/2436991], and being unusually comfortable around the shipgirls under his command (and vice versa, for the most part), to the point that it's normal to see him [[mixed-sex bathing|bathing alongside them]] (to the shock of "newcomers":[/posts/2757604]).

Skills: Ranger, Airborne, CQC, marksmanship, skiing, and a variety of other disciplines.

Preference in female swimsuits: [[wetsuit]] (practical); [[bikini]] and [[competition swimsuit]] (personal)

[i]I love that little gun![/i]
-- [[Engineer (tf2)|]] on his Combat Mini-Sentry Gun

A weapon that is automatically aimed and fired at targets that are detected by sensors. Commonly associated with the Engineer from [[Team Fortress 2]] due to the Sentry Gun he can build. Enemies that get close to it will get shot and receive a lot of damage.

h4. TF2 Levels and Weaponry

* Level 1 = Semi-Automatic Firing Barrel
* Level 2 = Dual Rotational Minigun Barrels
* Level 3 = Dual Rotational Minigun Barrels + Target Guided Rocket Launch Support System
* Mini-Sentry = Semi-Automatic Firing Barrel

title: colosseum
body:
Originally the [b]Flavian Amphitheatre[/b], an elliptical amphitheatre in the centre of the city of [[Rome (city)|]], [[Italy]], the largest ever built in the Roman Empire, built of concrete and stone. It is considered one of the greatest works of Roman architecture and Roman engineering and is also famous as a [[gladiator]]ial arena. The name is derived from the Colossus of Rhodes, a giant statue of Apollo which stood near (but not inside) the Amphitheatre.

Note that this tag is not limited to the [[real life]] colosseum, as it also includes fantastical depictions of an [[arena]] inspired after the real life arena.

h4.See also

* [[Arena]]

title: postal_(game)
body:
[b]Postal[/b] is a shooter game franchise created by Running with Scissors, known for its excessive violence and controversial content. The games follow the misadventures of the Postal Dude, the cynical anti-hero who tries to survive everyday life while dealing with an ever changing cast of crazy characters and defending himself from rude civilians, rabid police, violent rednecks, terrorists, crazy protestors, wild animals, zombies, robots and other sort of enemies. 

To date, there are four Postal games which include:

* Postal
* Postal 2
* Postal III
* Postal 4: No Regerts

title: ren_&_stimpy
body: The Ren & Stimpy Show (also known as Ren & Stimpy) is an American animated television series created by Canadian animator John Kricfalusi. Originally produced by Spümcø for [[Nickelodeon]], the series aired from August 11, 1991, to December 16, 1995, with a total of five seasons and 52 episodes. The series follows the adventures of the title characters: [[Ren Hoek|Ren Höek]], an emotionally unstable and sociopathic dog; and [[Stimpy]], a good-natured yet dimwitted cat.

title: corona_borealis_(constellation)
body:
Corona Borealis (the Northern [[Crown]]) is a small [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. Its brightest star is Alphecca. The constellation has a southern counterpart, [[Corona Australis (constellation)|]] (the Southern Crown).

Corona Borealis consists of seven connected stars resembling the letter [b]u[/b]. In rare cases, it can also be made up of six stars.

h5. Example shapes
* !asset #21432300
* !asset #21432302: Rare

h5. Example posts
* post #6516596, bottom left corner (blurry)
* post #6740198, above blue ribbon

h5. Neighboring constellations
* [[Bootes (constellation)|]]
* [[Hercules (constellation)|]]
* [[Serpens (constellation)|Serpens Caput]]

h4. External links
* "eSky: Corona Borealis":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/coronaborealis.html
* "Wikipedia: Corona Borealis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corona_Borealis
* "Study-Style (JP): Corona Borealis":https://www.study-style.com/seiza/CrB.html

title: lyra_(constellation)
body:
Lyra (the [[Harp]] or [[Lyre]]) is a small [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. It symbolizes the lyre of "Orpheus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orpheus, the legendary musician in Greek mythology. Its brightest star is [[Vega (star)|]], part of the "Summer Triangle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_Triangle.

Lyra forms a parallelogram with a line attached to the corner and ending with its brightest star. Sometimes the line takes the shape of a 7 or changes to a triangle. 

h5. Example shapes
* !asset #21153900
* !asset #21153901

title: waldstein_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. An old man with relation to both the Night Blade and Licht Kreis. He accompanies [[Linne (under night in-birth)|]] in her search for a means to end her life. Originally a part of Licht Kreis; Waldstein crossed Kuon on the battlefield, after absorbing several amounts of [b]EXS (Exist)[/b], Waldstein began to mutate into a Void. Kuon fortunately drives most of the EXS out of his body. Waldstein, thankful for Kuon saving his life; is now in debt to him and accompanies Kuon's sister, Linne, as part of Kuon's final request.

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] Ishii Kouji [b]EN:[/b] Keith Silverstein


h4. External links

* "Waldstein Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Waldstein#Official

title: chaos_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is a tactician who works for the organization, Amnesia. He is good friends with [[Gordeau (under night in-birth)|]] and wants help him track down [i][[Erika Wagner|The Crimson Knight]][/i]. His book, [i]The Codex of Disorder: Chaos Code[/i], allows him to command a lizard-shaped beast Void known as Azhi Dahaka. His EXS, Umbral, allows him to manifest creatures from books. Chaos is also known by the alias, [i][b]Bloody Chaos[/b][/i] which he isn't very found of. His real name is [b]Kei Asuma[/b] [b](明日真景)[/b].

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Matsuoka Yoshitsugu]]


h4. External links

* "Chaos Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Chaos

title: gordeau_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is a former member and one of the founders of Amnesia. Nowadays, he works as a mercenary on behalf of them. Ever since the transformation of his friend, Roger, who became a Void and was killed at the hands of [i][[Erika Wagner|The Crimson Knight]][/i], He developed a vendetta against her and the rest of Licht Kreis. He is good friends with fellow Amnesia member [i][[Chaos (Under Night In-Birth)|Bloody Chaos]][/i] and a former friend of [i][[Hilda (Under Night In-Birth)|Paradox]][/i].  

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Toriumi Kousuke]] [b]EN:[/b] Ian Sinclair


h4. External links

* "Gordeau Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Gordeau

title: kuu_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
[[Under Night In-Birth]] character.

A small [[dragon]]-like [[creature]] that follows [[Linne (under night in-birth)|]] around, likening it to a [[pet]].

Voiced by Takada Hatsumi.

title: seth_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is an assassin who currently works for an unknown client. A long time ago, Seth's ancestors were one of the many families that fought among each other in Night Blade. He also has some connection with [[Linne (under night in-birth)|]], as he wishes to save her from her curse of reincarnation. To achieve this, he seeks out [i]The Insulator[/i] who currently resides with [[Kido hyde|Hyde]], which leads to them clashing in the events of the story. While Hyde doesn't want to end Linne's life just yet, Seth insists that he ends her life as soon as possible.

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Kaji Yuuki]] [b]EN:[/b] [[Mark Whitten]]


h4. External links

* "Seth Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Seth

title: creepypasta
body:
Urban legends or scary stories circulating on the Internet, many times revolving around specific videos, pictures or video games. The term "creepypasta" is a mutation of the term "copypasta": a short, readily available piece of text that is easily copied and pasted into a text field. "Copypasta" is derived from "copy/paste", and in its original sense commonly referred to presumably initially sincere text (e.g. a blog or forum post) perceived by the copy/paster as undesirable or otherwise preposterous, which was then copied and pasted to other sites as a form of trolling.

(Source: Wikipedia)

h4. Examples of creepypastas
* [[Ben Drowned]]
* [[Jeff the Killer]]
* [[Slender Man]]
* The [[Backrooms (creepypasta)|]]
* [[Sonic.exe]]

title: rain_world
body:
Rain World is a unforgiving survival platform game, featuring breath-taking pixel art scenery. The player takes the role of a creature called a [[slugcat]] trying to survive in an alien, post-apocalyptic ecosystem. It was developed by Videocult and published by Adult Swim Games and Akupara Games in 2017.


h4. External links

* "Official website":[https://rainworldgame.com/]
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rain_World]

title: hans_(deemo)
body:
[b]Warning: The existence of this character in itself is a spoiler.[/b]

[spoilers]The late elder brother of [[alice (deemo)|Alice]], and an expert pianist. The story of Deemo begins with his sacrifice for the sake of his sister. In the dream world Alice falls into in the ensuing coma, he manifests as [[Deemo (character)|]].[/spoilers]

title: masked_lady_(deemo)
body:
[quote]The music [[deemo (character)|you]] [[alice (deemo)|two]] are playing is really hard on the ears.[/quote]

A mysterious girl dressed in a [[white coat]] and [[mask]] who seems to oppose the arrival of the [[alice (deemo)|Girl]].

[spoilers]Her true name is Celia, an anagram of Alice, the girl who she is a mental reflection of. Underneath the mask, she looks exactly like Alice.[/spoilers]

title: deemo_(character)
body:
[quote]...[/quote]

[quote][[Alice (deemo)|Girl]]: (I don't know what he's saying, but he seems friendly.)[/quote]

The titular focus of the game [[Deemo]]. A thin, silhouette-like humanoid that accompanies the [[Alice (deemo)|Girl]] in the world she falls into. They work to discover and play songs on a piano sprouting out of it, in the hopes of making it grow large enough to allow the Girl to climb back through the window she came from.

[spoilers]Is later revealed to be the mental manifestation of [[Hans (deemo)|Hans]], the Girl's older brother and an expert pianist who died saving her life in a traffic accident.[/spoilers]

title: tablet_pc
body:
A tablet computer, commonly just called a tablet, is a portable [[computer]] housed within the casing of a handheld touchscreen display.  They appear like a larger version of the modern [[smartphone]].

Unlike [[laptop|laptops]], tablet computers lack a built-in [[computer keyboard|keyboard]].  Should not be confused with a 2-in-1 laptop, which is a laptop that features a touchscreen with the ability to flip or rotate so the display can conceal the laptop keyboard.

A popular example of a tablet computer is the [[iPad]].

Should not be confused with a [[drawing tablet]], which is a computer input device that enables a user to hand-draw images on a computer.

h4. See also

* [[Tourbox]]

title: computer_tower
body: Also called a computer case, this is the enclosure that contains most of the components of a [[computer]] excluding the [[monitor]], [[computer keyboard|keyboard]] and [[computer mouse|mouse]].

title: angry_german_kid
body:
The "Angry German Kid" is the main character in a viral video, depicting a young teen having a violent temper tantrum when things don't go his way in a video game.

In reality, the video was staged, and was intended by its creator (the teen who plays the Angry German Kid) as a parody of what many people feared, that violent video games would lead to gamers being violent.  It is one of a series of videos made by the teen, who parodies other societal phenomena such as the "gangster".  However, when the video was played on German TV, the TV producers lied and told the audience that this was an unstaged incident, secretly taped by the boy's father.

In Japan, he is referred to as the “[[computer keyboard|KeyBoard]] Crusher” or “KBC”.

http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/angry-german-kid-keyboard-crasher
other_names: キーボードクラッシャー

title: chads_dancing_to_california_gurls_(meme)
body:
[b]Chads Dancing To California Gurls In Friday the 13th: The Game[/b] is a viral video trend in which players of [[Friday the 13th]]: The Game perform the "shake it" emote in front of [[Jason Voorhees]] using the [[Chad Kensington]] character while wearing the "spring break 1984" clothing with [[Katy Perry]]'s "[[California Gurls]]" playing in the background. The trend has spread outside the game, which has resulted in live-action fan videos involving the dance, as well as videos of characters from other video games performing the dance.

h4. See also

* [[meme]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Chads Dancing to California Gurls":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/chads-dancing-to-california-gurls-in-friday-the-13th-the-game]

title: skin_suit_(stellar_blade)
body:
A [[bodysuit]] outfit for [[eve_(stellar_blade)|Eve]] in [[Stellar Blade]].

As its name suggests, it is a skin-colored bodysuit that [[revealing clothes|exposes large amount of skin of the wearer]], which combined with the color of the suit itself (with the "skin" part of the suit suggestively covering Eve's breasts and [[ass]]) can make Eve appears as if she was naked.

Not recommended for new players as it greatly increases the damage Eve takes, making the game considerably more difficult.

h5. In-game description:
[i]"Changes the appearance of Eve. Skin suits are outfits specifically crafted by Mother Sphere. It covers the body of Airborn Squad Member and deploys on its own, or expands and contracts depending on the situation. In other words, it's like a living skin. (Shield is disabled when you put on this Skin Suit.)"[/i]

title: hookah
body:
A single or multi-stemmed (often glass-based) water pipe for [[smoking]]. Originated from India. Operates by water filtration and indirect heat. It can be used for smoking herbal fruits, tobacco, or even marijuana.

The [[caterpillar]] from Lewis Carroll's book [[Alice in Wonderland]], is illustrated smoking one of these.

h4. See also

title: akatsuki_(akatsuki_blitzkampf)
body:
h5. [[Akatsuki Blitzkampf]]

A High class technical officer of the Imperial army. Believed to have died in the Arctic oceans at a critical time when the war was coming to its end, during the transportation of a new military unit from an allied country. Fifty years later, he returns alive and unchanged in appearance. Now wielding superhuman abilities, he resumes his mission.

h5. [[Under Night In-Birth]]

Guest character in [b]Under Night In-Birth[/b]. He gets involved in the Hollow Night while traveling to [[Mount Fuji]] to destroy the Blitz Motors. He fights many In-Births along the way, often times being mistaken for a [[cosplay|cosplayer]]. He apparently gets really [[hungry]] when ever he taps into his Blitz Motor. 

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] Matsumoto Shinobu [i](credited as "Hijikata Shouji" in Akatsuki Blitzkampf)[/i] [b]EN:[/b] [[Kaiji Tang]]


h4. External links

* "Akatsuki Mizuumi Entry":https://wiki.gbl.gg/w/Akatsuki_Blitzkampf/Akatsuki
* "Akatsuki Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Akatsuki

title: erika_wagner
body:
Character in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is the 4th Executor of Licht Kreis and she is best known as [b]"The Crimson Knight"[/b] . Her family has served Licht Kreis for centuries, acting as the "blades" that smite their enemies. Among all the members of Licht Kreis, she is the most feared and ruthless fighter of all the Executors, perpetuated by her bloodlust and utter brutality against her foes. She also seems to have a rivalry with [[Orie ballardiae harada|Orie]].

h5. Voice Actresses

[b]JP:[/b] [[Ishigami Shizuka]]


h4. External links

* "Wagner Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Wagner
other_names: 宮代・エリカ・ワーグナー

title: phonon_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is a senior middle school student who is childhood friends with [[Nanase (Under Night In-Birth)|Nanase]], although they have grown apart as of late. Phonon has an interest in supernatural phenomena and has several [[chuunibyou]] tendencies which is partly how she became an In-Birth. Her real name is [b]Yoshiko (良子)[/b]. She was originally based on the scrapped character idea, [b]Chemeti[/b].

h5. Voice Actresses

[b]JP:[/b] [[Oonishi Saori]]


h4. External links

* "Phonon Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Phonon

title: nanase_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is a middle school student who became an In-Birth after run-in with [[Kido hyde|Hyde]]. After waking up and realizing what she'd become, she was mortified and wanted to get revenge on Hyde, believing he had "defiled" her. During the Hollow Night, she comes across other girls who she also believed to be "defiled" by Hyde, which makes her even more furious as to why they are "protecting" him. [spoiler]By the end of it all, she becomes a [[tsundere]] towards Hyde, after realizing that her powers aren't permanent.[/spoiler]

h5. Voice Actresses

[b]JP:[/b] Iizuka Mayu


h4. External links

* "Nanase Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Nanase
